resources.string: If you feel you might be suicidal, and live in the United States, the Suicide Hotline provides free and confidential support:
For a live chat and additional resources.
If it\'s not an emergency, but you want to know more about mental health, the National Alliance on Mental Illness offers information on their website:
If you do not live in the United States, please seek out local resources.

Taking a break from your task can be helpful. If you’re anxious, forcing yourself to work continuously may cloud your thoughts and make you unable to focus. Taking a few minutes to yourself to relax means that you can return to your work with a fresh start that will aid you in keeping your attention on the task.

If the weather is appropriate, going for a walk outside can be a good way to relax yourself. Fresh air will allow you to clear your head and calm your thoughts, and you’ll be able to continue what you were doing previously in a more focused manner. Try visiting one of the local parks.

Contact someone you care about and talk with them. Telling someone about your feelings and what’s bothering you can make you feel less stressed or anxious about the idea overall. Take a few minutes to call or message one of your friends or family members to chat with them, and you’ll be able to calm yourself down.

If you’re feeling anxious, taking an hour to nap can be beneficial as it can reduce your anxiety. Whether you actually fall asleep or not, laying in bed will naturally calm you down. If you have a pressing task at hand, this method likely isn’t recommended because it may make you more tired overall. Overall, taking a short nap is a good idea as long as you don’t have a task that needs to be finished quickly.
Take a couple minutes to breathe.
Steady breathing will help calm your nerves and leave you more relaxed.
When breathing, count in fives. Inhale for five seconds, hold your breath for five seconds, exhale for five seconds, hold for five seconds once more, and repeat.
The pattern will calm you and slow your thoughts down, so you’ll be able to return to your task with less anxiety.
Breathe in while the shape below expands and breathe out as it contracts. Focus on your breathing.
Meditation is a good method to calm yourself. A few minutes each day to meditate can help you feel more relaxed as a person overall.
1. Sit in a comfortable position. Make sure the position that you choose is one that you’re all right with sitting in for a few minutes as switching positions may interrupt your focus.
2. Close your eyes and try to clear your thoughts of any of your worries.
3. Focus on your breathing and feel your body move as you breathe.
4. Remain focused on your breathing for a few minutes or until you feel calmer. When you feel like you’ve finished meditating, you can open your eyes and go back to what you were doing before.
